definition: to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to expand/to push sth with the hand/to develop/to open up
to make a rubbing (e.g. of an inscription)

sentences.english: In Hong Kong many square miles of land have been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在香港，許多平方英里的陸地都是填海開拓出來的。

sentences.english: Only through creating & innovating, can one make progress continuously.
sentences.chinese: 只有開拓創新，才能不斷前進。

sentences.english: All the sites I chose for this article broke new ground in this area.
sentences.chinese: 本文中挑選的所有站點都在業內開拓了新天地。

sentences.english: Since founded more than 20 years ago, we put all our efforts on produce high quality multi-functional tools.
sentences.chinese: 本公司建廠二十多年來不斷專注於開拓高質量的產品。

sentences.english: The several opinions on opening up the LNG market in Southeast Fujian are proposed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 文中還對如何開拓閩東南LNG市場提出幾點看法。

sentences.english: The Portland Trailblazers have been doing bad this year.
sentences.chinese: 波特蘭開拓者是做壞今年。

sentences.english: Many farm also actively explore some personalized service to appeal to consumers.
sentences.chinese: 不少農家樂還積極開拓一些個性化服務吸引消費者。

sentences.english: A unique narrative strategy is to narrative drama of a pioneering approach.
sentences.chinese: 全劇獨特的敘事策略是對電視劇敘事手法的一種開拓。

sentences.english: Also develops the international market for us to build the good solid foundation.
sentences.chinese: 也爲我們開拓國際市場打下良實的基礎。

sentences.english: He is recognized as a pioneer of special effects photography predating digital imaging.
sentences.chinese: 他被視爲早於數字圖像的特效攝影開拓者。

sentences.english: Microsoft, the emphasis is on innovation capability.
sentences.chinese: 微軟講究的是開拓創新能力。

sentences.english: Sanhui people will march on further for greater target.
sentences.chinese: 勇於開拓的“三惠人”將目光投向了更遠大的目標。

sentences.english: Chinese settlers helped tame the American continent during the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 中國移民在19世紀爲開拓美洲大陸作出了貢獻。

sentences.english: "Innovative, brave in exploitation" is our persistent pursuit.
sentences.chinese: “敢於創新，勇於開拓”是我執著的追求。

sentences.english: Any business with an exportable product or service should be exploring new markets.
sentences.chinese: 任何一家擁有出口產品和服務的公司都應開拓新市場。

sentences.english: Anyway, we should seriously study the tradition and hardily develop the future.
sentences.chinese: 我們要紮實的學習傳統又要大膽地開拓未來。

definition: to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to open up/to set up/to establish
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
